2. Aircraft with IMA can realize reductions in the bulk and ... of their avionics
systems?

3. Does an aircraft with IMA need more supplies or less supplies than the aircraft
traditional (non-IMA)?
4. Traditionally, on non-IMA aircraft, each avionics system had
Answers: A. its own separate indicator and its own separate controls

Questions.QuestionString:
5. The use of ...indicators saves space and weight, and it streamlines pilot
workload by reducing the number of indicators that must be scanned during flight.
6. An IMA aircraft might have
Answers: A. Only one power supply that is capable of supplying all twenty modules.

B. Two redundant power supplies that are each capable of supplying all twenty
modules.

C. Three redundant power supplies that are each capable of supplying all twenty
modules.

Questions.QuestionString: 7. IMA aircraft are typically ... fault-tolerant than traditional aircraft.
8. If one of the IMA power supplies fails
Answers: A. The relate modules are lost
B. There are still two redundant power supplies that can power the modules

Questions.QuestionString: 9. With IMA, the data processing circuitry can be contained in
10. The use of digital data buses... the amount of wiring used in an aircraft.
Answers: C. Don't use wires, use wifi connection

Questions.QuestionString:
11. The wires inside the braided shield of an ARINC 429 data bus are referred to as
a ….
Answers: B. twisted pair with grounded wire
C. twisted pair with not grounded wire

Questions.QuestionString: 12. ARINC 629 can transfer up to
Answers: A. One hundred million bits per second
C. Two million bits per second

15. IMA systems consist of
Answers: A. A central system and peripherals
B. a core system and LRUs (Line Replaceable Units)
C. a core system and network components

Questions.QuestionString: 16. The ...uses the same computer processors for many different purposes
17. The core system contains data processing circuitry that processes
Answers: B. Many different kinds of information

Questions.QuestionString: 18. ... include input and output devices and data bus wiring.
19. What is the function of NETWORK COMPONENTS?
Answers: A. allow data to be transferred into and out of the core system
B. allow data to be transferred into and out of the modules

Questions.QuestionString: 20. The LRM is stand for
21. In Boeing B777, AIMS stands for
22. The AIMS is interconnected with many other units in the aircraft
Answers: A. It receives input data from these units only
B. it provides output data to them only
C. It receives input data from these units and it provides output data to them

Questions.QuestionString: 23. The AIMS displays information on
24. The basic features of IMA are:
Answers: A. Modular design, Integration of modules within the system and Flexibility

B. Modular design, Integration of modules within the system and Use of digital data
buses for interconnection

C. Modular design, Integration of modules within the system, Use of digital data
buses for interconnection, Fault tolerance and Flexibility

Questions.QuestionString: 25. IMA systems can be categorized into functions of?
Answers: C. Cabin, cocpit, air-conditioning and other systems

Questions.QuestionString: 26. Which of the following statements is correct?
Answers: A. on non-IMA aircraft, more indicators and controls had to be installed
B. on IMA aircraft, more indicators and controls had to be installed
C. IMA aircrafts are outdated systems

Questions.QuestionString: 27. On Non-IMA aircraft, more electrical power is required to operate the system
28. What are the advantages of using the IMA integrated system?
29. The IMA (Integrated Modular avionics) perform
Answers:
A. The functions formerly performed by the independent LRUs, completely
independent.

B. The functions formerly performed by the independent LRUs, but they are not
independent.

C. The functions formerly performed by the independent LRUs, but they are not
completely independent. They share circuitry.

Questions.QuestionString: 30. Which of the following statements is correct?
Answers:
A. Traditional (non-IMA) avionics suites have many separate LRUs ("black boxes")
located in an avionics compartment

B. IMA aircraft avionics suites have many separate LRUs ("black boxes") located in
an avionics compartment

C. each black box in the avionics compartment typically integrated modular power
supply

Questions.QuestionString: 31. In the IMA aircraft. All avionics modules do not afected by failure of
Answers: A. One of the power supply
B. One or even two of the power supplies
C. Three of the power supplies

Questions.QuestionString: 32. What Digital data buses are more important others?
Answers: B. ARINC 429 and AFDX (Avionics Full Duplex).
C. ARINC 429, ARINC 629, and AFDX (Avionics Full Duplex).

Questions.QuestionString: 33. What is correct with traditional avionics systems?
Answers:
A. Each piece of information to be transferred from one location to another requires
at least one separate wire
B. Information can be transferred using only two wires
C. Often, a smaller number of wires is needed

Questions.QuestionString: 34. The core system’s processing power is shared among various functions
Answers: A. This sharing need to have a processor in each and every system
B. This sharing eliminates the need to have a processor in each and every system
C. This sharing only in the same system

36. How many digital data transfer formats which the AIMS uses for sending and
receiving information?
37. Why IMA aircraft are more fault tolerant, providing better reliability?
Answers: A. There are Redundant Power supplies
C. Many backup modules for others

Questions.QuestionString: 38. Why do aircraft with IMA significantly reduce aircraft weight?
Answers: A. All parts on the plane are connected by wireless
B. Use common power for modules, use of digital data buses
C. All modules in Avionic are integrated into two Modules

Questions.QuestionString:
39. AFDX in comparison to other data transfer formats, such as ARINC 629 and
ARINC 429, has?
Answers: A. More data than Non-IMA Aircraft
B. Much lower data capability, reliability and fault tolerance.
C. Much higher data capability, reliability and fault tolerance.

Questions.QuestionString: 40. Which of the following statements is correct?
Answers:
A. AFDX has characteristics of: good integration and ease of interfacing; reduction in
cable interconnects and wiring; high bandwidth; high reliability and fault tolerances.

Questions.QuestionString:
41. The internal data transfer format for CPIOM (core processor input/output
modules) in IMA systems is?
42. Partitioning of Core-processor computers in IMA systems is?
Answers: A. Isolation of each IMA system to prevent interaction.
B. conect of each application system to interaction.
C. Isolation of each application system to prevent interaction.
